Questions.Question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
Questions.Explanation: Leonardo da Vinci, a renowned Italian artist, painted the Mona Lisa during the Renaissance period.

Questions.Question: Which city is known as the birthplace of the Renaissance?
Questions.Explanation: Florence, Italy, is considered the birthplace of the Renaissance due to its cultural and artistic achievements.

Questions.Explanation: Michelangelo, an Italian artist, painted the iconic ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in Vatican City.

Questions.Question: Which famous scientist developed the heliocentric theory?
Questions.Explanation: Nicolaus Copernicus, a Polish astronomer, proposed the heliocentric theory, stating that the Earth revolves around the Sun.
